description: The 'Blue Pearl' known for its vibrant blue-washed houses and narrow streets in the Rif Mountains.
name: Chefchaouen

description: One of the largest mosques in the world, featuring intricate tilework, a retractable roof, and stunning ocean views.
name: Hassan II Mosque

description: A bustling central square in Marrakech, filled with food stalls, snake charmers, acrobats, and a variety of local performers.
name: Jemaa el-Fnaa

description: Dramatic canyons carved by the Dades River, offering scenic hikes, waterfalls, and kasbahs (traditional fortified villages).
name: Dades Gorges

description: Roman ruins of an ancient city, showcasing impressive mosaics, temples, and triumphal arches.
name: Volubilis

description: Vast desert landscape with towering sand dunes, popular for camel trekking and stargazing under clear skies.
name: Erg Chebbi Sand Dunes

description: A spectacular canyon with towering cliffs along the Todgha River, perfect for hiking and exploring.
name: Tinghir Todgha Gorge

description: A laid-back coastal town with beautiful beaches, a relaxed atmosphere, and a well-preserved medina (old town).
name: Essaouira

description: The tallest waterfalls in Morocco, surrounded by lush greenery and offering breathtaking views.
name: Ouzoud Waterfalls

description: A 17th-century fortress with beautiful gardens and panoramic views of the blue-washed city.
name: Chefchaouen Kasbah

description: A historic fortified village made of earthen clay buildings, often used as a filming location for movies.
name: Ait Benhaddou

description: A botanical garden and artist's landscape garden with exotic plants and vibrant blue buildings.
name: Majorelle Garden

description: A historic kasbah in Rabat with narrow streets, Andalusian gardens, and views of the Bou Regreg river.
name: Kasbah of the Udayas

description: Expansive desert offering camel treks, sandboarding, and the experience of traditional Berber camps.
name: Sahara Desert

description: Ruins of a magnificent palace built in the 16th century, showcasing Moroccan architecture and history.
name: El Badi Palace

description: Historic public gardens with olive groves, a large pool, and a pavilion overlooking the Atlas Mountains.
name: Menara Gardens

description: The largest mosque in Marrakech, known for its impressive minaret and beautiful gardens.
name: Koutoubia Mosque

description: The royal palace with its stunning golden gates, beautiful mosaics, and large gardens.
name: Royal Palace of Fez

description: A modern university set in the picturesque town of Ifrane, often called 'Little Switzerland'.
name: Al Akhawayn University

description: The Blue Gate, a famous entrance to the old medina of Fez, decorated with blue and green tiles.
name: Bab Bou Jeloud

description: A historic madrasa in Fez known for its exquisite architecture and detailed woodwork.
name: Bou Inania Madrasa

description: A museum showcasing traditional Moroccan arts and crafts, housed in a former palace.
name: Dar Batha Museum

description: A coastal town known for its Spanish colonial architecture, beautiful beaches, and laid-back atmosphere.
name: Sidi Ifni

description: A popular beach destination with golden sands, modern amenities, and a lively promenade.
name: Agadir Beach

description: A mountain range offering stunning views, hiking opportunities, and traditional Berber villages.
name: Atlas Mountains

description: A holy town and pilgrimage site, known for its whitewashed buildings and significant religious history.
name: Moulay Idriss Zerhoun

description: Historic royal tombs with intricate carvings and beautiful gardens, dating back to the Saadian dynasty.
name: Saadian Tombs

description: A UNESCO World Heritage site with narrow streets, traditional markets, and Spanish-influenced architecture.
name: Medina of Tetouan

description: A museum housed in a beautiful palace, showcasing Moroccan art, pottery, and historic artifacts.
name: Marrakech Museum

description: A 19th-century palace known for its beautiful gardens, intricate mosaics, and stunning architecture.
name: Palais Bahia

description: A historic Islamic college with beautiful courtyards, intricate carvings, and traditional Moroccan architecture.
name: Medersa Ben Youssef

description: A coastal town known for its whitewashed buildings, vibrant murals, and annual cultural festival.
name: Asilah

description: A cave complex near Tangier with stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean and mythological significance.
name: Hercules Cave

description: An ancient town known for its traditional souks, historic sites, and proximity to the Erg Chebbi dunes.
name: Rissani

description: A small village near the Erg Chebbi dunes, popular for desert tours, camel treks, and sandboarding.
name: Merzouga

description: A stunning beach known for its red sandstone arches, scenic views, and tranquil atmosphere.
name: Lagzira Beach

description: A picturesque valley with natural rock pools, waterfalls, and lush greenery, perfect for hiking and swimming.
name: Paradise Valley

description: The final resting place of King Mohammed V and his two sons, featuring stunning architecture and historical significance.
name: Mausoleum of Mohammed V

description: A national park offering diverse landscapes, from cedar forests to deep gorges, ideal for hiking and wildlife viewing.
name: Tazekka National Park
